RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 51. Maiden Claiming Purse 21200. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, For Each $2,500 To $10,000 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EXCLUSIVE ROSE accelerated to the lead two deep at the five sixteenths pole, dueled clear midway on the turn and was steadily handled to hold on. KELSEY'S ANGEL gave chase, raced in the three and four paths on the turn, dug in to take second later yards and was gaining on the winner. SULTRY SALLY H chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the two and three paths then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. ESTILO AMOROSO set a pressured pace most of the opening quarter mile then pressured the winner, dropped back midway on the turn and weakened the final sixteenth. LOOKING FOR FLARE chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. EVERYDAYISAGIFT gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn, exchanged light contact with CAMI RACHELLE passing the eighth pole and showed little more. The latter gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn, exchanged contact with Everydayisagift leaving the eighth pole and weakened. LADY IN WAITING was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Estilo Amoroso
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief early lead,met 5/16,dropped back mid turn,weakened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Kelsey's Angel
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Metropolitan Thoroughbreds LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Exclusive Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: up 2d 5/16,dueled clear mid turn,held on driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 97. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COASTAL MISSION took over nearing the three quarter pole, moved to the rail and was firmly rated, kept the advantage at the rail on the turn, drifted leaving the turn though, won handily. FREEDOM RIDER exchanged contact with LATE IN THE GAME leaving the gate, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the turn and proved no match in the lane. The latter exchanged contact with Freedom Rider leaving the gate then saved ground, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, drifted leaving the turn and flattened stride. FORTY STRIPES rounded the opening turn in the three path, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. CANDY INVASION raced in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole but flattened stride in the five path of the far turn. STEAL THE CASH rated close to the early pace off the rail, gave chase from the three eighths pole then weakened into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Forty Stripes
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p 1st turn,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Coastal Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,kept advantage rail turn,drifted 1/8,handily

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 13800. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHROME HEIR settled in the three path early on, progressed from the half mile pole and took the lead three wide approaching the five sixteenths, widened at the rail on the far turn and was taken in hand through the lane. ONLY GET'N BETTER raced well back inside, bid leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn in the five path and came along for second. BIG REDWHITEBLUE took the lead at the rail nearing the seven eighths pole and rated the pace, was met toward the three eighths, dueled from that point but dropped back between horses at the five sixteenths, raced in the three path of the far turn and flattened in the lane. ENANO saved ground well off the early pace, eased out on the second turn and gave chase from the nine sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. ADARA saved ground off the pace, closed toward contention at the rail on the second turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. LIGHT WORK raced well off the early pace about the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and weakened. TIZNOW TIME drifted at the seven eighths pole then stalked, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths but weakened approaching the far turn. SHADE TREE CORNER rated close to the early pace then faded through the second turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Redwhiteblue
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met 3/8,dropped back 5/16,3p far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Enano
ENTRY.OWNER: Pleasant Fields at Harmony Hill LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,eased out 2nd turn,chased 9/16,4p far turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Only Get'n Better
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back inside,bid leaving 1/2,5p far turn,along 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Light Work
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 3p,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Chrome Heir
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p,bid leaving 1/2,up 3wd near5/16,drew off,in hand lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In El igibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MIZZEN stalked three wide on the first turn, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, dueled to the lead mid-stretch and inched clear nearing the wire. TOUT ENSEMBLE saved ground off the pace, bid leaving the three eighths pole, improved off the rail on the far turn then dug in at the rail through the lane to take second the final yards. KOBE'S GIRL moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn but was met mid-stretch and flattened inside the sixteenth pole. HIGHWAY QUEEN raced well back off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the five sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn and could only close the gap in the lane. SALAMINA settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch then flattened stride while losing ground on the far turn. LADY LICIOUS rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. CAPTIVATING GAL stalked from the three path the first turn then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Licious
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Salamina
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 1/2,flattened losing ground far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Tout Ensemble
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,dug in rail lane,up 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Highway Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back off rail,bid 5/16,off rail far turn,closed gap lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DON'TCALLTOOEARLY was forced out leaving the gate then settled off the rail on the opening turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, circled rivals in the six path on the far turn, lugged in under right hand urging leaving the turn and exchanged light contact with ZIGGY STARDUST while taking the lead in the final yards. The latter ducked out leaving the gate then stalked from the four path the first turn, took the lead four wide approaching the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, drifted into the lane and was caught while exchanging contact with Don'tcalltooearly in the final yards. REVEREND JACK raced with the pace inside, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. COMEONTURNMELOOSE settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path then flattened stride later yards. JUST MURPHY stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and flattened in the lane. COLONIAL ROAD raced with the early pace between horses, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded through the backstretch. GOLDEN ARROW raced with the pace three wide, was met nearing the three eighths pole, gave chase from that point but weakened at the rail on the far turn. DON'T GET CAUGHTUP rated close inside on the first turn then faded through the backstretch. TOTHETRAINSTATION was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Reverend Jack
ENTRY.OWNER: Hasty Rebel Stables LLC and Carlisle Horse Company

ENTRY.NAME: Comeonturnmeloose
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,5p far turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace 3wd,met near 3/8,chased,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Ziggy Stardust
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,stalked 4p,up 4wd near 3/8,rail turn,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Don'tcalltooearly
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out break,off rail,bid3/8,circled6p turn,lugged in,up late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 91. Starter Allowance Purse 24000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE APRIL 8, 2021. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since March 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since February 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JAYJAYDEE raced with the pace inside then stalked from the nine sixteenths pole, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths, rounded the far turn off the rail, dug in for the lead inside the sixteenth pole and drew clear approaching the wire. RAISE A SPEIGHTS raced with the pace off the rail, took the lead two deep leaving the nine sixteenths pole and came under pressure at the three eighths, raced near the rail on the far turn, was met mid-stretch and relented later yards. WELLING raced in the five path the first two turns, gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn off the rail and flattened inside the eighth pole. CANTAKEITANYMORE saved ground off the pace, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail into the far turn, came through the turn in the three path and showed little in the lane. UNEQUIVOCAL settled off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. DR. FERBER showed little response leaving the second turn. ONE TWO KID rated close inside, gave chase into the backstretch but weakened approaching the far turn. OUR HOISTED MAST raced in the six path the first turn, saved some ground on the second turn and showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: One Two Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 1/2,weakened near far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Cantakeitanymore
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,rail into far turn,3p turn,empty lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BODYSLAM was shut off leaving the gate then chased through the backstretch, steadily improved off the rail on the turn, dug in the final furlong and came between horses for the lead in late yards. GOLDEN ADAGE pressured the pace and raced close in the three path on the turn, then dueled through the stretch for second while outfinished for the win. THE CLOWN pressured the pace from the half mile pole, rounded the turn about the four path and finished well at the outside withers of Golden Adage. RUNAWAY ROAD set a pressured pace leaving the half mile pole, raced near the rail on the turn and dug in through the lane, but was caught flattening stride late yards. TAKE AIM ducked out leaving the gate then chased the pace, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. MEXICAN KRYPTONITE broke a step slow and dropped well back. MONEY MAC was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Take Aim
ENTRY.OWNER: Jones Jr Michael E and JKX Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Bodyslam
ENTRY.COMMENT: shut off break,chased,off rail turn,dug in lane,up between late

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Brant M. Laue & Spendthrift Stallions, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Runaway Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,caught flattening late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Wh ere Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NO DENYING DENIS was bumped leaving the gate and saved ground well off the pace, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the turn about the five path, was carried out into the lane, lugged in leaving the turn but took over late yards and held on well. LUCKY BLONDE saved ground, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced two deep on the far turn, dueled through the stretch to take second late yards but was outfinished for the win. KEEP ON SPURRIN ducked in and made contact with No Denying Denis leaving the gate then settled in the three path, bid past the seven sixteenths pole, took the lead three wide approaching the quarter, raced clear midway on the turn but was met mid-stretch and flattened the final sixteenth. LAUGHINTOTHEBANK saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, angled out toward the head of the lane, was blocked at the heels of No Denying Denis mid-stretch, but came back to finish evenly. IHEARTRAINACOMN stalked from the two and three paths, challenged and took the lead at the seven sixteenths pole but was met approaching the quarter, raced close through the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. FRENCHIES GOLD bobbled at the break, rounded the first turn about the four path then gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and ran evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. NEW AGE BAD GIRL raced well back off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, ran in the three path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. NEAREST N DEAREST was not a factor. MAKINLIMMARGARITAS rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. DENALI D'ORO closed to the lead while tapering inward, was met at the seven sixteenths pole and dueled close from that point, rounded the far turn at the rial and weakened. The Stewards reviewed then dismissed a claim of foul against the rider of Keep On Spurring for alleged interference mid-stretch, lodged by the rider of Iheartrainacomn.

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Makinlimmargaritas
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close early,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: New Age Bad Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Krishack Joanne P and Krishack Stephan E
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back,chased 7/16,3p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: No Denying Denis
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,saved ground,bid 7/16,5p turn,up late,held well

ENTRY.NAME: Frenchies Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled break,4p 1st turn,chased 7/16,5p far turn,flattened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE OCTOBER 8, 2022. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHINA CAT stumbled leaving the gate and saved ground well back, started a bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved, raced off the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and dug in to take the nod in the final strides. STYLISH PAINT stalked the early pace, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, dueled for the nod nearing mid-stretch and drew briefly clear, was allowed to relax in late yards and was nipped under the wire. TURN TO ME SUCREE moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, but was met toward mid-stretch and relented later yards. ONEPRETTYTHING rounded the opening turn about the three path, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, came through the far turn off the rail and ran evenly in the lane. SO RED THE ROSE settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail then flattened in the lane. DON'T MAKE ME BEG rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase into the backstretch but showed little response. MY EXPENSIVE GIFT saved ground well off the pace and showed little response. DUSTWHIRL WONDER was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Stylish Paint
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: China Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break,saved ground,bid 7/16,off rail,nod final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Make Me Beg
ENTRY.OWNER: Brooks Gerald E and Hess Jr Carl L
